posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi all ECBers

This was an interesting idea I brewed with my morning coffee...

Kensai Druid (focused in Scimitar, which Druid has a proficiency in)

AC boosted by his high Wisdom score, uber buffed by Owl's Insight

Later on this one can turn into a Dragon!

Base AB is 37 which is decent for a 'Spellsword', I have been thinking in my mind of ways to try to get that higher with no success. I wasn't willing to dump Cons any further 400hp odd is pretty important for a dedicated melee'er, and I think this chappy will be a tank with all that wisdom AC

Anyway fingers crossed the druidic disables plus other goodies like Bull's Strength / Blood Frenzy etc etc can buff up the stats high enough to give em a good whack

Buffs are dispellable atm, I could drop the AB by a few more points (by going a Druid 25 / WM 13 / Monk 2 split) to make em undispellable but I thought that might hurt this chaps combat prowess, also he misses out on useful bonus combat feats (ie EWF/EP/AS) which would hurt the AB even more

Why do I care about the AB if the build has polymorph? Just because I found it annoying to kill 'little dudes' later on with my first close to pure druid playthrough, I'd have to blow big spells like finger / stonehold, change to dragon shape limited to 3x/day and one has to shift back whenever one meets a doorway, or spend an eternity trying to hit em in Water Elemental form. At least with an AB of 37 I figured I might be able to use that scimitar to chop up the little dudes and save the dragon shape for the big bosses

The Uber Powergamer aiming for maximal level 40 power will probably want to go for a Druid 20 WM 19 Monk 1 split with a single monk level tumble dump at 37 but I thought that would hurt play-ability excessively during the leveling

I've pumped up stealth so this robed guy can kind of play like a scout with Druid's True Sight spell

Hehe stealth into a mob -> 'suddenly a dragon with 8 APR (with flurry & haste)  and DR 40/+6 / 60-70AC / 900 odd HP / Evasion just appears!'

No UMD and a bit feat starved. Improved Knockdown, Zen Archery or Toughness would have been nice.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I have to admit that I don't understand this build.
I would much rather see a build with focus either on shifting or on being a "Green knight". Here I get the feeling that the distant goal of once becoming a dragon destroys the chance to become an effective Scimitar-saint.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi Mick!
Thanks for trying to understand.
This is my first attempt at a sword saint type build.

It is ambitious, combining Dragon Shape and Scimitar Weapon Master 
Trying to do both does hurt its overall potential either as a Druid spellcaster or a Weapon Master
I was hoping perhaps the sky Wisdom AC could compensate but perhaps it doesn't quite do the task.

It should be pretty simple to drop Dragon Shape to make the Scimitar-saint with a much more effective AB
I'll see what I can come up with

Edit: Heres my second draft of the build
Much more Kensai without any dragon anymore
Has a base AB of 43
